page.title: 18Benfleet - The Village
page.content: Originally,in the early part of the century,the old village centre clustered around St.Mary's church. There was a general store and school, the area would have declined completely when the shops spread up the High Road, were it not for the location of the railway station in Ferry Road. This brings commutors to Benfleet village where they park their cars on the car park,situated on the site of the ancient 892 battle between the Saxons & Danes.(There is a plaque commemorating this event on the church wall).Benfleet is also alive at weekends,as the village has several leisure orientated businesses such as the three pubs with gardens,two restaurants,a shell fish bar,boat builders,yacht club and moorings. There are several small businesses located there as well.
